intro: Spiesia leptophysa, commonly known as the slender-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces a milky latex when damaged, which is a common feature among members of its family. Spiesia leptophysa is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun conditions.
